question.title: Is it thread-safe to use OPCPackage.open in a multi-threaded environment
question.body:
This is a piece of test code with POI. It reads an Excel file as a template to write data and saves it locally. This code will eventually be executed under a web application, meaning it will be accessed concurrently

public static void main(String[] args) throws FileNotFoundException, InterruptedException {
    List<Thread> threadList = new ArrayList<>();
    for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
        Thread thread = new Thread(() -> {
            try (OPCPackage opcPackage = OPCPackage.open(new FileInputStream("C:\\Users\\samson\\Downloads\\temp.xlsx"))) {
                SXSSFWorkbook workbook = new SXSSFWorkbook(new XSSFWorkbook(opcPackage));
                Sheet sheet = workbook.getSheetAt(0);
                // 写入 100 条数据
                for (int j = 1; j <= 100; j++) {
                    Row row = sheet.createRow(j);
                    row.createCell(0).setCellValue(j);
                    row.createCell(1).setCellValue("用户" + j);
                    row.createCell(2).setCellValue(20 + j % 30);
                    row.createCell(3).setCellValue("user" + j + "@example.com");
                }
                // 写入文件
                try (FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream("C:\\Users\\samson\\Downloads\\" + Thread.currentThread().getName() + "_large_data.xlsx")) {
                    workbook.write(fos);
                }
            } catch (IOException e) {
                throw new RuntimeException(e);
            } catch (InvalidFormatException e) {
                throw new RuntimeException(e);
            }
        });
        threadList.add(thread);
    }
    threadList.forEach(Thread::start);
    for (Thread thread : threadList) {
        thread.join();
    }
}

I created multiple threads to execute the code logic simultaneously. I found that the generated file content did not detect any anomalies, but I'm not sure if this code is thread-safe.
